summary: In this context, 1,4-dichlorobenzene is highlighted as a treatment performance indicator during the microfiltration/reverse osmosis (MF/RO) process for removing volatile organic compounds (VOCs) from water. The monitoring of 1,4-dichlorobenzene levels is crucial for assessing the effectiveness of the MF/RO treatment process, indicating its direct relevance to the operational procedures and risk management in water treatment technologies.
